text:
Front Street, at Gouverneur Slip. The view shows the rear of the Gouverneur Hospital. April 16, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Front Street - Gouverneur Slip

text:
Front Street, north side, at Gouverneur Slip. Shown is the rear of Gouverneur Hospital.
About 1929.

Ewing Galloway.

315G
LOCAL HISTORY
AND GENEALOGY
title: Manhattan: Front Street - Gouverneur Slip

text:
(1)
Front Street, north side, east from but not including Gouverneur Slip, to and including Jackson Street.  Nos. 352-356 and Nos. 366-384 Front Street, are frame houses.

March 31, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, further eastward.

March 31, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, a closer view of No. 338 Front Street.

March 31, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET TO BE EAST AND WEST.

title: Manhattan: Front Street - Gouverneur Slip

text:
(1)
Front Street, north side, east from (No. 348), but not including Gouverneur Slip to Jackson Street. The garage in the foreground, is on the former sites, numbered Nos. 344 to 352 inclusive; adjoining same, are houses Nos. 354 to 366. East of the vacant lots (formerly Nos. 368 to 384 inclusive) is St. Rose's Home, located at the N.W. corner of Jackson Street. The 10-story Hecker, Jones, Jewell Milling Co. Building, appears on the right, across Corlears Hook Park.
March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A closer view of Nos. 358 to 362. The stable building shown is No. 360.
March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A view similar to No. 1, but at an earlier date.
March 1929.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

title: Manhattan: Front Street - Gouverneur Slip

text:
(1)
Gouverneur Slip, north from Front, to Water Streets (where it terminates), showing Nos. 2-4, a 1-story garage bearing also No. 312 on Front Street, (seen on the left), and No. 12, a 4-story building at the S.W. corner of Water Street. On the right appears (house with semi-circular balconies) a portion of Gouverneur Hospital, at the N.E. corner of Front Street.
March 23, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same at a later date.

April 25th, 1939.

P.L.Sperr,

title: Manhattan: Gouverneur Slip - Front Street

text:
FrontStreet, north side, at Gouverneur Street, showing Gouverneur Hospital, as photographed from South Street and across the clearance for the new East River Drive.

November 18, 1939
April 7, 1940

P. L. Sperr

315G
LOCAL HISTORY AND GENEALOGY

title: Manhattan: Front Street - Gouverneur Slip

text:
(1)
Front Street, northside between the Slip and Jackson Streets, showing Manhattan, Bridge head.
September 18, 1939.

(2) and (3)
Front Street, west side of Jackson, north from South Street, showing across clearing on Front Street, rear of building facing on south side of Water Street.

P.L.Speer.
August 14, 1939.
